content.description: Sure, this has been done as a solo, but it is not on the website. It is on the far left side of West face. Look for the offwidth/chimney that climbs up between the main formation and a small pinnacle, and follow it up to a large shelf that can be followed South to the other route's bolts. This is pretty easily protected with nuts and log draws. It has lots of hidden, positive holds.
content.location: This is on the far left side of West face. Look for the offwidth/chimney that climbs up between the main formation and a small pinnacle.

content.description: This is the only bolted/sport route on the East Block. Make a couple of easy moves, stemming between the main wall and a detached block. Pull onto the main face, and clip the first bolt. Traverse out left on a big ledge, and make an easy move before clipping the second bolt. Continue straight up on smaller holds to the chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains. This route can be toproped via an exposed 4th class approach.
content.location: To the right of the big tree on the East Block, look for the only bolted line.

content.description: A couple of tricky intro moves leads to straightforward, moderate climbing to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the leftmost climb on the west face of the East Block.

content.description: A couple of thought-provoking moves off the ground (the crux) lead to 20 feet of fun pinches and sidepulls.
content.location: It is on the north side of the East Block.

content.description: This technical face is thought-provoking and fairly sustained. A couple of thin moves off the ground lead to a small "roof". Surmount the roof (the crux), and enjoy easier, technical climbing to the top of the crag.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Crack Route

.

content.description: This is the most continuous crack system on the west face of the East Block.
content.location:
This is left of

Roof Route

on the west face of the East Block.

content.description: This ascends the right-facing corner on the north side of the East Block. A few jams and stemming lead to a two-bolt anchor.
content.protection: A light rack to 3"...or top rope from a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the north side of the East Block.
